text: Mahalia Melts in the Rain is a Canadian short drama film, directed by Emilie Mannering and Carmine Pierre-Dufour and released in 2018. The film stars Kaiyonni Banton-Renner as Mahalia, a young Black Canadian girl who feels self- conscious about her African-Canadian hair setting her apart from her classmates at ballet school, leading her mother Anika (Sagine Sémajuste) to take her to a hair salon to get her hair straightened."Festival Filministes: quand la relève prépare la relève". Le Devoir, March 8, 2019. The film premiered at the 2018 Vancouver International Film Festival. At the 7th Canadian Screen Awards in 2019, the film was shortlisted for Best Live Action Short Drama."Prix Écrans canadiens 2019 : la domination québécoise".
